title: I honestly kinda hate new kayle (Lemme explain before auto downvote ty)
body: Like dont get me wrong the visual update and even kit update look great! But much like kassadin i hate the whole. "Well you are an 'okay' champ for a while but then you hit lv 16 and literally cant be beaten by anyone" this kind of playstyle isnt fun to play against. I hate the idea of being bursted down by someone with 3 seconds of invuln. who also does true damage.. like i know i know she just came out but like can we just end this rampage of creating champions that delete everyone and everything at lv 16

it's kind of hard to see but the channel time for the aoe damage and the duration of invulnerability are 2 separate instances. 

She channels for 1.5 seconds no matter what level her ult is, so by lvl 3 ult, she gets 1.5 seconds where she can attack while invulnerable.

> She channels for 1.5 seconds no matter what level her ult is, so by lvl 3 ult, she gets 1.5 seconds where she can attack while invulnerable.

yep, and that's why her ult sucks.
She has some invulnerability time to attack, the channel on the blades doesn't last the whole invulnerability duration.
it still scales and does damage regardless. Lol.
Idk man if you can’t win a 4v5 before level 16 then the team that scraped through the whole game due to a non impactful kayle should deserve to win. __
You speak the word of god. I hate late game hyper carries so much. It's like hey, you made it to late game? Ok have fun killing everyone with a major advantage,

hyper carries were fine when their early games were truly bad and the difference between mid-to-late game power difference wasn't earth shattering.

Now a hyper carry is a champion that excells at all stages only to deal even more damage then rest in lategame.

My guess is Riot knew they broke this design af, so they made kayle with serious and obvious power gates, just to be sure her early-mid game DOES SUCK.

because of shortening a game they made late game champs hit their spikes earlier and also game stages overlaping and harder snowbaling with more gold flying around make this "late" game carries efectively  mid game carries with only one condition: survive this now very short early game and dont feed lane oponent

Kayle isnt like the other hyper late picks tho, she is legit garbo until level 11.

Vayne still beats a shitton of marksmen 1v1 at lvl 3 if she plays her cards well enough or gets lucky, kog hits 1-2 items and he might win then and there.

Twitch? 3 items and its legit a 70% winrate for him, and it only rises for each additional item. 

Kayle? Needs level 11........and basically does not win against anything before then, nor does her "true power" come up until level 16.

Might be slightly unbalanced, looking at her ult damage mainly,  at this time being new but the concept is absolutely valid in her case.


If we compare her to marksmen then she is actually far more balanced, partly because she cant auto attack for half her ult, partly because unlike marksmen she doesnt have any range until 11 so even if you give her 3 items by giving her two pentakills at level 5 she still wont do anything really.

Any marksmen instead would just win the game the moment they get a large lead, doesnt matter if you won other lanes because that Draven/vayne/twitch now instakills anything you bring near them from level 6 forward. 

Kayle? She literally cant get ahead on her own, she cant even win on her own, it makes her sooooo much more manageable.

That's the whole point.

Twitch, vayne, riven, whatever are hyper carries that were, by design, supposed tobe **useless **for minimum half of the game. But because of items and runes they are great at every point of the match.

Kayle is Riots way of returning to that design of hyper carry, but now she has her power locked, so she won't turn out exactly like other hyper carries. That's the ONLY reason why she's as she is.

Heck nope.

Kayle as a champ in a match doesnt even exist before level 11, she isnt like Vayne that actually beats a number of enemies 1v1 right from level 3 and on, nor like kog that might just decide to melt anything from 1-2 items onwards.

Nope she has to hit level 11 to even exist after massively losing lane, then she has to hit 2 items and then hit 16 to get her max power, all after having lost lane and being behind.

This based on the fact that she is so weak early than a vast majority would stomp her in lane as long as excessive jungle intervention doesnt happen. 


Kayle, if anything right now, is a great example of what a lategame hypercarry should be, because if you cant win a 4v5 before she hits like....level 13 and gets 2-3 items then you have basically screwed up, really damn hard.
It's because riot wants to make Jax less meta but can't directly nerf his because people would flip a shit, so they add in characters that do what he does but better. As a m6 jax, I'm hella sad.

It is dumb to deal with if she reaches that point. There is literally nothing you can do against it as a melee champion, especially one without a dash ability or hard CC.

She just melts you, while you fail to close the gap or even escape. After losing to it, it makes me question why I even still play this game.

Tbh something nobody has talked about is how she cant attack during her R. She used to be able to just press R and spam AA without counterplay. Atleast now you can kind of run out of her R zone. Although it kind of is worse in high elo where your allies arent idiots and Ring them is better than yourself.
You haven't played against her have you? She is self silenced for half her max rank ult.

I play a tank against her and build Frozen Heart + Randiun + Tabi, thinking the attack speed slow would weaken her but her true damage still able to shred through my defense. Try to go in to get some damage and get out and she still able to chase me with her passive. It's like a Yi on permanent ulti, maybe the difference is that Yi also ignore attack speed slow and she has to reach late game to get that much power. But still, there is not a true weakness when she get to late game. The early set back is just make her somewhat borer to play as. Kayle play style is more like a Nasus now, unlike Ornn and Syndra whom also got more power late game but still interesting to play early.
Honestly, she sort of makes Veigar and Nasus seem balanced...

She can't basic attack during her ultimate anymore. The whole time the swords are being prepped and land she can't attack at all.

That said the rest of this opinion is valid.
At level 11 she turns into a champion instead of trash. At level 16, she's about as strong as old kayle. She's got her issues, but I don't think being strong is one of them.
